title: Escape velocity - final velocity of rocket

content.question: A rocket of mass <math alttext="lowercase m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>m</mi></math> is launched vertically from the surface of a planet with speed <math alttext="2 v sub escape" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>esc</mtext></msub></math>, where <math alttext="v sub escape" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>esc</mtext></msub></math> is the escape speed of the planet. The planet has mass <math alttext="uppercase M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>M</mi></math>, radius <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>R</mi></math>, and no atmosphere. Which of the following expressions is equal to the speed of the rocket when it is very far from the planet and the gravitational force exerted by the planet on the satellite is negligible?

choices.label: <math alttext="2 times the square root of the fraction 2 G uppercase M over R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><msqrt><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>G</mi><mi>M</mi></mrow><mi>R</mi></mfrac></msqrt></math>
<math alttext="the square root of the fraction 6 G uppercase M over R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msqrt><mfrac><mrow><mn>6</mn><mi>G</mi><mi>M</mi></mrow><mi>R</mi></mfrac></msqrt></math>
<math alttext="the square root of the fraction 10 G uppercase M over R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msqrt><mfrac><mrow><mn>10</mn><mi>G</mi><mi>M</mi></mrow><mi>R</mi></mfrac></msqrt></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the square root of the fraction 6 G uppercase M over R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msqrt><mfrac><mrow><mn>6</mn><mi>G</mi><mi>M</mi></mrow><mi>R</mi></mfrac></msqrt></math>
